title: Volunteers in psych lab not apply to population

content.question: A researcher at a local university is studying the effects of low light in visual processing in the occipital lobe. The results of this correlational study involving student volunteers in a psychology laboratory might not apply to the general population because of which of the following?

choices.label: laboratory environments are generally too artificial to generate accurate results
the sample is not randomly chosen and therefore may not be a representative sample
only experimental studies apply to the general population
in a correlational study, no variables are actually manipulated

content.answer: the sample is not randomly chosen and therefore may not be a representative sample

skill.text: 2.B: Evaluate the appropriate use of research design elements in experimental methodology.
